New Records: Fernando Tatis Jr. is one shy of the NLDS record held by Carlos Beltran (2004, Houston) and Nick Castellanos (2023, Philadelphia) for most home runs in a series
Key Match Events: Fernando Tatis Jr.'s towering two-run home run highlighted a six-run second inning
Teoscar Hern√°ndez hit a grand slam with one out in the third
Mookie Betts homered for the Dodgers to break an 0-for-22 playoff slump
Post-Match Reflections: The Padres moved within one victory of eliminating the Dodgers in the NLDS for the second time in three seasons
Miscellaneous Highlights: A rally towel-waving record crowd of 47,744 was in attendance at Petco Park
Robert Suarez struck out Gavin Lux on a full-count pitch to complete a four-out save
